faq.a1: Prompt Party is a social network for sharing, discovering, and remixing AI prompts.
faq.a2: Yes! Prompt Party is completely free to use. You can create an account, share prompts, and build collections at no cost.
faq.a3: Yes, when creating a prompt you can choose to make it private. Private prompts are only visible to you.
faq.a4: Remixing allows you to create a new prompt based on an existing one. Your remix will credit the original creator.
faq.a5: Collections let you organize prompts into groups. You can create public collections to share with others, or private collections for personal use.
faq.a6: Prompts support full Markdown including headers, bold/italic text, code blocks, lists, links, and images.
faq.a7: Yes, you can edit or delete your prompts at any time from your profile page.
faq.a8: Trending prompts are calculated based on recent likes and comments, showing you what's popular right now.
faq.contact_text: Contact us or open an issue on our GitHub repository.
faq.page_description: Frequently asked questions about Prompt Party
faq.q3: Can I make my prompts private?
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

marketing_suite.comparison_subtitle: Choose the plan that fits your needs
marketing_suite.faq_1_a: Start using Marketing Suite immediately with full access to all features. No credit card required. If you love it (you will), upgrade after 14 days. Otherwise, downgrade to Free with no questions asked.
marketing_suite.faq_1_q: How does the 14-day free trial work?
marketing_suite.faq_2_a: Yes! Upgrade to unlock more features or downgrade if your needs change. Changes take effect immediately, and billing is prorated.
marketing_suite.faq_2_q: Can I upgrade or downgrade anytime?
marketing_suite.faq_3_a: Marketing Suite includes unlimited testing on GPT-4, GPT-3.5, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Claude 3.5 Haiku, Gemini 1.5 Pro, and Gemini 1.5 Flash. Compare results side-by-side.
marketing_suite.faq_4_a: Invite up to 2 additional team members or clients. Share collections, collaborate on prompts, and manage permissions. Perfect for agencies working with clients.
marketing_suite.faq_4_q: How does the Mini-Team feature work?
marketing_suite.faq_5_a: Yes! 14-day money-back guarantee, no questions asked. If Marketing Suite doesn't save you 10+ hours in the first 2 weeks, we'll refund 100%.
marketing_suite.faq_6_a: Absolutely! All prompts and AI outputs can be used for commercial purposes. Create content for your business or clients without restrictions.
marketing_suite.feature_analytics_desc: Track prompt performance, A/B test results, and ROI. Export PDF reports for clients.
marketing_suite.feature_brand_desc: Train AI on your brand style. Get consistent, on-brand content every time.
marketing_suite.feature_library_desc: Pre-tested prompts for copywriting, SEO, social media, ads, and email marketing
marketing_suite.feature_support_desc: <2h response time + 12 masterclasses/year on advanced AI marketing strategies.
marketing_suite.feature_team_desc: Collaborate with clients or colleagues. Share collections and prompts seamlessly.
marketing_suite.feature_testing_desc: Test prompts on GPT-4, Claude 3.5, and Gemini simultaneously. Compare results instantly.
marketing_suite.features_subtitle: Stop juggling multiple tools. Get everything you need to create world-class marketing content.
marketing_suite.features_title: Professional Marketing Tools in One Suite
marketing_suite.final_cta_features: ‚úì No credit card required  ‚Ä¢  ‚úì 14-day free trial  ‚Ä¢  ‚úì Cancel anytime
marketing_suite.final_cta_subtitle: Join 1,000+ marketers who save 10+ hours per week with Marketing Suite. Start your 14-day free trial today.
marketing_suite.hero_no_card: No credit card required ‚Ä¢ Cancel anytime ‚Ä¢ 14-day money-back guarantee
marketing_suite.hero_subtitle: The complete AI marketing suite with 500+ proven prompts, multi-LLM testing, brand voice training, and advanced analytics. Purpose-built for marketers and content creators.
marketing_suite.hero_title: Save 10+ Hours Per Week on Content Creation

mcp.analogy_mcp_3: ‚Ä¢ It can act on the world
mcp.analogy_mcp_4: ‚Ä¢ But it has no long-term memory
mcp.cta_description: Use our wizard to create RAG or MCP prompts
mcp.examples_mcp_2_desc: Search products, create orders, track deliveries
mcp.examples_mcp_3_desc: Create tasks, send notifications, generate reports
mcp.hero_description: Understanding the differences between two fundamental paradigms of modern AI
mcp.hybrid_finance_answer: Answer: Summary with historical context (RAG) + live data (MCP)
mcp.hybrid_finance_question: Question: Analyze AAPL and compare to recent quarters
mcp.hybrid_hr_answer: Answer: According to our policy (RAG), you're entitled to 25 days. You have 12 days left this year (MCP ‚Üí HR API).
mcp.hybrid_hr_question: Question: How many days off do I have left?
mcp.hybrid_subtitle: Combine both for advanced use cases
mcp.mcp_description: It's like giving the AI a toolbox it can use to take action.
mcp.page_description: Complete guide to understanding the differences between MCP (Model Context Protocol) and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
mcp.page_title: MCP vs RAG: Understanding the Differences | Prompt Party
mcp.rag_description: It's like giving the AI an open book with the relevant pages already found.

ml.analogy_dl_1: üß† Like a kid learning by watching, without explanation
ml.analogy_dl_2: üë∂ He sees tons of faces and learns on his own
ml.analogy_dl_3: üé¨ Perfect for photos, videos, sounds, text
ml.analogy_dl_4: ‚ö° But needs LOTS of examples and time
ml.analogy_ml_1: üßë‚Äçüè´ Like a coach explaining how to spot a great athlete
ml.analogy_ml_2: üë§ He tells you: 'Look at height, speed, endurance'
ml.analogy_ml_3: üìä Works well with just a few athletes as examples
ml.analogy_ml_4: üõ†Ô∏è But you need to know what to look for
ml.comparison_applications_dl: Recognize images, understand language, listen, self-driving cars
ml.comparison_computation_dl: Need SUPER powerful and special computers (GPU)
ml.comparison_cost_dl: Expensive! Need powerful servers and tons of data
ml.comparison_cost_ml: Cheap! Can do it on an old computer
ml.comparison_data_ml: Small! A few thousand is enough
ml.comparison_definition_dl: Computer learns patterns on its own without being told what to look for
ml.comparison_definition_ml: You tell the computer 'look for size and weight', and it learns on those
ml.comparison_features_ml: You must tell the computer what to look for (manual)
ml.comparison_interpretability_dl: It's mysterious - nobody knows why it decided that
ml.comparison_interpretability_ml: You can explain: 'It's small and light, so it's an apple'
ml.comparison_training_ml: Fast! A few hours or days
ml.cta_description: Now you know the difference - let's build real projects!
ml.decision_question: ‚ùì Do you have TONS of photos/videos/data?
ml.decision_yes_desc: Use Deep Learning for tasks with lots of data
ml.dl_description: When a computer learns ALL BY ITSELF how to find the rules. Like a kid learning to recognize their parents' faces without anyone explaining it.
ml.dl_limit_1: Needs TONS of examples (thousands or millions)
ml.dl_limit_2: Needs super powerful and expensive computers
ml.dl_limit_3: Mystery - nobody knows why it decided that
ml.dl_strength_1: Insanely accurate results that blow your mind
ml.dl_strength_2: Discovers the rules all on its own
ml.dl_strength_4: Works with huge amounts of data
ml.dl_use_1: ‚Ä¢ Recognize faces or objects in photos
ml.dl_use_3: ‚Ä¢ When you say "OK Google" and it understands
ml.examples_dl_1_desc: Recognizing objects in photos (cars, cats, trees), Instagram filters, self-driving cars
ml.examples_dl_2_desc: ChatGPT understanding your questions and answering, automatic translation
ml.examples_dl_3_desc: When Siri or Google Assistant understands what you say, auto-subtitles on videos
ml.examples_ml_1_desc: Banks check your income, age, job to decide if you can borrow $1000
ml.examples_ml_2_desc: Netflix or Spotify recommends movies/music based on what you watch/listen to
ml.examples_ml_3_desc: When a weird big purchase happens on your card, the bank blocks it
ml.hero_description: What's the difference between Machine Learning and Deep Learning? Discover how computers learn in two completely different ways
ml.hybrid_cv_dl: Deep Learning: Looks at a photo and figures out what's important on its own
ml.hybrid_cv_ml: Machine Learning: Then we tell it 'Now decide if it's a cat or a dog'
ml.hybrid_cv_solution: Result: DL sees the details, ML judges fast - super efficient!
ml.hybrid_nlp_dl: Deep Learning: Understands what the text means and the context
ml.hybrid_nlp_ml: Machine Learning: Makes a quick decision based on that
ml.hybrid_nlp_solution: Result: Faster and smarter than just using DL alone
ml.hybrid_subtitle: Often the two together is better than one alone!
ml.hybrid_title: üöÄ The Best Solution: Mix ML and DL
ml.ml_description: Teaching a computer to make decisions by showing it examples. Like teaching someone to recognize an apple by showing them 100 different apples.
ml.ml_limit_1: You have to tell it what to look for
ml.ml_limit_2: Needs an expert to set up
ml.ml_strength_4: You can explain why it decided that
ml.ml_use_1: ‚Ä¢ Decide if someone can get a loan
ml.page_description: Complete guide to understanding the differences between Machine Learning and Deep Learning, when to use each, and how to combine them
ml.page_title: Machine Learning vs Deep Learning | Prompt Party

mcp_integration.what_is_mcp_text: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables AI models and assistants to securely access external data sources and tools. Prompt Party's MCP endpoint provides structured access to our prompt library, allowing AI assistants to discover, search, and retrieve prompts programmatically.

faq.answer_1: Yes. All courses, tutorials, tools, and core features remain 100% free, with no time limit. That's our commitment.
faq.answer_2: Of course! You can cancel anytime, no commitment. You keep your benefits until the end of your current month.
faq.answer_3: Yes! Share the platform, contribute prompts, help in the forum, or make a one-time donation. Every contribution counts.
faq.answer_4: Nothing changes! Everything remains free and accessible. Support is 100% optional and doesn't affect access to educational content.
faq.question_3: Are there other ways to support?
faq.title: Frequently asked questions

free.description: Everything you need to learn AI
free.name: Free

metadata.description: Support the Prompt Party project and help us keep AI education free for everyone

support.description: Support the project and help us stay free
support.name: Support

why_support.reason_1_description: Your support allows us to keep all courses, tutorials, and tools 100% free for everyone, without ads.
why_support.reason_2_description: We invest in new learning paths, video tutorials, webinars, and tools for the community.
why_support.reason_3_description: We simplify AI in French to make it accessible to everyone, without language or price barriers.
why_support.reason_4_description: Servers, development tools, API integrations - all of this has a cost that your support covers.
why_support.title: Why your support matters

pricing_full.cta_subtitle: Join thousands of prompt engineers building the future of AI
pricing_full.faq_1_a: AI tests let you run your prompts against GPT-4, Claude, or Gemini to see results before sharing. Free users get 10 per month, Pro users get unlimited.
pricing_full.faq_2_a: Yes! Upgrade instantly, downgrade at the end of your billing cycle. No long-term commitments.
pricing_full.faq_2_q: Can I upgrade or downgrade anytime?
pricing_full.faq_3_a: We offer a 14-day money-back guarantee on all paid plans. No questions asked.
pricing_full.faq_4_a: Team plans are billed monthly at $29 for up to 10 members. Need more seats? Contact us for custom pricing.
pricing_full.faq_5_a: Yes! Pay annually and get 2 months free (16% discount). Switch to annual billing in your account settings.
pricing_full.subtitle: Start free, upgrade when you're ready. All plans include access to our community.
pricing_full.title: Choose Your Plan

privacy.changes_text: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page.
privacy.contact_text: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us through our GitHub repository.
privacy.cookies_text: We use cookies and similar technologies to maintain your session and improve your experience. You can control cookies through your browser settings.
privacy.data_storage_text: Your data is stored securely using Supabase (PostgreSQL) with encryption at rest. We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your information.
privacy.how_use_3: Communicate with you about updates and features
privacy.how_use_text: We use the information we collect to:
privacy.info_collect_text: When you use Prompt Party, we collect information that you provide directly to us, including:
privacy.sharing_text: We do not sell your personal information. Public content you create (public prompts, comments) is visible to other users. Private prompts and collections remain private.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy

terms.accounts_text: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password. You agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account.
terms.changes_text: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of significant changes via email or platform notification.
terms.contact_text: For questions about these terms, please contact us through our GitHub repository.
terms.content_text: You retain ownership of content you create on Prompt Party. By posting content, you grant us a non-exclusive license to use, display, and distribute your content on the platform.
terms.disclaimer_text: Prompt Party is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. We do not guarantee the accuracy, reliability, or availability of the service.
terms.intellectual_text: When you remix a prompt, you must credit the original creator. We respect intellectual property rights and expect users to do the same.
terms.liability_text: We shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use of the service.
terms.moderation_text: We reserve the right to remove content and suspend accounts that violate these terms or our community guidelines.
terms.termination_text: We may terminate or suspend your account at any time for violation of these terms. You may delete your account at any time through your profile settings.

intro_prompts.title: Introduction to AI Prompts
intro_prompts.subtitle: Learn the fundamentals of AI prompting
intro_prompts.page_description: Master the basics of AI prompting
intro_prompts.what_is_prompt_intro: An AI prompt is a text instruction you give to an AI model to generate a specific output.
intro_prompts.vague_description: Lacks clarity on subject, format, and purpose
intro_prompts.specific_example: Write a 500-word blog post about the history of Egyptian cats with historical facts
intro_prompts.specific_description: Clearly specifies format, length, and subject
intro_prompts.anatomy_title: The Anatomy of a Good Prompt
intro_prompts.element_context_desc: Provide context and background to help the AI understand your request
intro_prompts.element_context_example: I am a marketing manager for a tech startup
intro_prompts.element_task_desc: Clearly explain what you want the AI to do
intro_prompts.element_constraints_desc: Define limits and requirements (length, tone, format)
intro_prompts.element_constraints_example: Each idea max 280 characters. Tone: professional but friendly
intro_prompts.element_format_desc: Specify the output format you want (list, JSON, table)
intro_prompts.element_format_example: Return as a bulleted list with titles and descriptions
intro_prompts.mistake1_good: Write a 200-word LinkedIn post about AI in marketing for B2B SaaS
intro_prompts.mistake2_good: Give me 5 content ideas as a JSON array with title and description
intro_prompts.mistake3_good: Analyze this customer feedback for a B2B SaaS product
intro_prompts.mistake3_note: Always provide context about who, what, and why
intro_prompts.template_writing_desc: Use this for blog posts, emails, social content
intro_prompts.template_writing_code: I am a [role]. Write a [type] about [topic] in [tone].
intro_prompts.template_analysis_desc: Use this for reviews, summaries, classifications
intro_prompts.template_code_desc: Use this for code generation and debugging
intro_prompts.template_learning_desc: Use this to explain concepts or teach topics
intro_prompts.exercise1_prompt: Transform this vague prompt into a specific one: 'Write something funny'
intro_prompts.exercise1_hint: Include format, tone, topic, and length
intro_prompts.exercise2_prompt: Improve this prompt by adding context: 'Generate marketing copy'
intro_prompts.exercise2_hint: Who is the audience? What product? What's the goal?
intro_prompts.exercise3_prompt: Create a complete prompt for generating a technical blog post about prompt engineering
intro_prompts.exercise3_hint: Use the template and include all elements

claude_code_basics.page_title: Claude Code Basics | Learn AI-Powered Development
claude_code_basics.page_description: Master Claude Code, the AI development assistant. Learn setup, practical usage, best practices, and real-world examples.
claude_code_basics.title: Claude Code Mastery
claude_code_basics.subtitle: Master the AI-powered development assistant for faster, smarter coding
claude_code_basics.learn_1: Understand Claude Code capabilities and use cases
claude_code_basics.learn_2: Set up Claude Code on cloud or CLI
claude_code_basics.learn_3: Generate, refactor, and debug code with AI
claude_code_basics.learn_4: Integrate Claude Code into your development workflow
claude_code_basics.section_1_intro: Claude Code is an AI-powered development assistant that understands your project context and generates code following your established patterns and conventions.
claude_code_basics.section_1_feature_1_desc: Reads your CLAUDE.md and understands your project structure, tech stack, and coding standards
claude_code_basics.section_1_feature_2_desc: Refactors existing code while maintaining TypeScript safety and design patterns
claude_code_basics.section_1_feature_3_desc: Identifies bugs and suggests fixes with full understanding of your codebase
claude_code_basics.section_1_feature_4_desc: Creates comprehensive documentation aligned with your project standards
claude_code_basics.vs_copilot_desc: Unlike Copilot which works at the file level, Claude Code understands your entire project context including architecture, conventions, and business logic.
claude_code_basics.section_2_cloud_desc: Access Claude Code directly from your browser with cloud-based development
claude_code_basics.section_2_cli_desc: Install the Claude Code CLI for local development with full terminal integration
claude_code_basics.section_2_github_desc: Link your GitHub repository for seamless repository access and context
claude_code_basics.section_2_github_step_1: Create a CLAUDE.md file in your repository root
claude_code_basics.section_2_github_step_2: Add project overview, tech stack, and coding standards
claude_code_basics.section_2_github_step_3: Authenticate Claude Code with your GitHub account
claude_code_basics.section_2_claude_md_desc: Your CLAUDE.md is the foundation for context-aware AI development
claude_code_basics.section_3_tip: Start with simple requests before moving to complex features. The more context you provide, the better Claude Code performs.
claude_code_basics.section_3_refactoring_desc: Ask Claude Code to improve existing code by refactoring patterns, extracting utilities, or optimizing performance
claude_code_basics.section_3_debugging_desc: Share error messages and code context. Claude Code will identify root causes and suggest fixes
claude_code_basics.section_4_example_1_desc: Generate a complete responsive dashboard with sidebar, header, and main content area
claude_code_basics.section_4_example_result: Result: Production-ready component with TypeScript types and Tailwind styling
claude_code_basics.section_4_example_2_desc: Migrate state management from Redux with less boilerplate and better types
claude_code_basics.section_4_example_3_desc: Create a complete API with authentication, rate limiting, and error handling
claude_code_basics.do_1: Provide clear, specific requirements with context
claude_code_basics.do_4: Use Claude Code for architecture decisions
claude_code_basics.do_5: Integrate into your team's workflow gradually
claude_code_basics.avoid_3: Using Claude Code for business logic design alone
claude_code_basics.avoid_4: Blindly trusting generated code without review
claude_code_basics.section_5_integration_2: Use code review as a learning tool
claude_code_basics.section_5_integration_3: Share successful prompts with your team
claude_code_basics.section_6_pitfall_1_desc: Claude Code is a tool, not a replacement for developer expertise. Always review and understand generated code.
claude_code_basics.section_6_pitfall_2_desc: If your CLAUDE.md is outdated or incomplete, Claude Code won't understand your project properly. Keep it updated.
claude_code_basics.section_6_pitfall_3_desc: Claude Code generates code that needs security review. Never merge untested code to production.
claude_code_basics.section_6_limitation_1: Cannot modify infrastructure or deployment configuration
claude_code_basics.section_6_limitation_2: Needs clear business logic explanation for complex algorithms
claude_code_basics.section_6_limitation_3: May generate code requiring significant refactoring
claude_code_basics.quiz_good: Good! You understand Claude Code well.
claude_code_basics.quiz_review: Review the material and try again.
claude_code_basics.quiz_q1: What is the primary benefit of Claude Code over GitHub Copilot?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q1_o1: It understands your entire project context and follows your conventions
claude_code_basics.quiz_q1_exp: Claude Code uniquely understands your project architecture through CLAUDE.md
claude_code_basics.quiz_q2_o3: Providing context to Claude Code about your project
claude_code_basics.quiz_q2_exp: CLAUDE.md contains project overview, tech stack, and coding standards
claude_code_basics.quiz_q3: How should you use Claude Code-generated code?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q3_o2: Review and understand it before merging
claude_code_basics.quiz_q3_o3: Use it only as a reference
claude_code_basics.quiz_q3_exp: Always review generated code for correctness and security
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4: What's the best way to structure a Claude Code request?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4_o1: Be specific with requirements and provide context
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4_o2: Use vague descriptions to encourage creativity
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4_o3: Ask for features without explaining the use case
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4_o4: Request multiple unrelated features at once
claude_code_basics.quiz_q4_exp: Clear, specific requests with context produce better results
claude_code_basics.quiz_q5: Which is NOT a recommended use case for Claude Code?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q5_exp: Claude Code should assist in decisions, not make them independently
claude_code_basics.quiz_q6: How should you handle security with Claude Code?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q6_o2: Always review code for security vulnerabilities
claude_code_basics.quiz_q6_o3: Only use Claude Code for non-sensitive code
claude_code_basics.quiz_q6_exp: Security review is essential for all generated code
claude_code_basics.quiz_q7: What should happen when Claude Code doesn't understand your code?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q7_o1: Give up and manually write the code
claude_code_basics.quiz_q7_o2: Improve your CLAUDE.md or provide more context
claude_code_basics.quiz_q7_exp: Better context in CLAUDE.md improves Claude Code's understanding
claude_code_basics.quiz_q8: Can Claude Code refactor your entire codebase at once?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q8_o1: Yes, but review the results carefully
claude_code_basics.quiz_q8_o2: Only refactor one file at a time
claude_code_basics.quiz_q8_exp: Gradual refactoring with review is safer than large-scale automated changes
claude_code_basics.quiz_q9: What's the best team practice with Claude Code?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q9_o1: Only let senior developers use it
claude_code_basics.quiz_q9_o2: Create team guidelines and share successful prompts
claude_code_basics.quiz_q9_o3: Never use it in a team setting
claude_code_basics.quiz_q9_exp: Team guidelines and shared knowledge maximize Claude Code benefits
claude_code_basics.quiz_q10: How often should you update your CLAUDE.md?
claude_code_basics.quiz_q10_o2: Every major update to the project
claude_code_basics.quiz_q10_exp: Keep CLAUDE.md updated to maintain Claude Code's accuracy

quiz.q1_question: What is the primary benefit of Claude Code over GitHub Copilot?
quiz.q1_option_1: It understands your entire project context and follows your conventions
quiz.q1_explanation: Claude Code uniquely understands your project architecture through CLAUDE.md and maintains consistency with your coding standards.
quiz.q2_question: What is the purpose of CLAUDE.md?
quiz.q2_option_2: Project context guide for Claude Code to understand your conventions
quiz.q2_explanation: CLAUDE.md is Claude Code's instruction manual, containing your project overview, tech stack, architecture, and coding standards.
quiz.q3_question: Which of the following is a good use case for Claude Code?
quiz.q3_option_1: Generating a production dashboard with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS
quiz.q3_option_2: Designing business logic for a new feature
quiz.q3_explanation: Claude Code excels at code generation and refactoring. For business logic design, you should provide clear specifications first.
quiz.q4_question: What should you always do before merging Claude Code generated code?
quiz.q4_option_3: Review the code thoroughly and understand what it does
quiz.q4_option_4: Test it with dummy data only
quiz.q4_explanation: Always review generated code to ensure it meets your requirements, follows best practices, and has no security issues.
quiz.q5_question: How does Claude Code handle project context?
quiz.q5_option_1: By reading individual files one at a time
quiz.q5_option_3: By using information from CLAUDE.md and your project structure
quiz.q5_option_4: It doesn't need context to generate code
quiz.q5_explanation: Claude Code reads your CLAUDE.md and understands your project structure to maintain consistency with your established patterns.
quiz.q6_question: What is a limitation of Claude Code?
quiz.q6_option_2: It cannot modify infrastructure or deployment configuration
quiz.q6_option_3: It only works with React projects
quiz.q6_option_4: It requires internet connection for each request
quiz.q6_explanation: Claude Code has clear limitations including not being able to modify infrastructure, deploy applications, or handle deployment configs directly.
quiz.q7_question: When should you update your CLAUDE.md?
quiz.q7_option_1: Only when you add new team members
quiz.q7_option_3: Whenever your tech stack, architecture, or conventions change
quiz.q7_explanation: Keep CLAUDE.md updated whenever your project changes. An outdated guide means Claude Code won't understand your current conventions.
quiz.q8_question: Which of these is a best practice when using Claude Code?
quiz.q8_option_1: Provide vague requests to test the AI
quiz.q8_option_2: Provide clear, specific requirements with full context
quiz.q8_option_4: Skip code review to save time
quiz.q8_explanation: Clear, specific requirements with proper context lead to better code generation. Always reference your CLAUDE.md and review generated code.
quiz.q9_question: What can Claude Code help you with?
quiz.q9_option_3: All of the above - generation, refactoring, debugging, and architecture discussions
quiz.q9_explanation: Claude Code is versatile - it helps with generation, refactoring, debugging, and serving as a sounding board for architecture decisions.
quiz.q10_question: How should Claude Code be integrated into your team's workflow?
quiz.q10_option_1: Replace all developers with Claude Code
quiz.q10_option_2: Never use it, stick to manual coding
quiz.q10_option_3: Gradually integrate it, use code reviews as learning opportunities
quiz.q10_option_4: Use it only for trivial tasks
quiz.q10_explanation: Gradually introduce Claude Code, use it as a productivity tool, and leverage code reviews to learn from AI-generated code.
quiz.title: Claude Code Mastery Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge of Claude Code, the AI-powered development assistant. Answer 10 questions to validate your understanding.

ragas_evaluation.page_title: Ragas Prompt Evaluation | Master Quality Metrics
ragas_evaluation.page_description: Learn Ragas framework for evaluating AI prompt quality. Master metrics, setup, CLI usage, code integration, and real-world examples.
ragas_evaluation.title: Ragas Prompt Evaluation
ragas_evaluation.subtitle: Systematically measure and improve your AI prompt quality
ragas_evaluation.learn_1: Understand prompt quality metrics and their importance
ragas_evaluation.learn_2: Install and configure Ragas with your LLM provider
ragas_evaluation.learn_3: Use Ragas CLI and Python API for evaluation
ragas_evaluation.learn_4: Integrate Ragas into your CI/CD pipeline
ragas_evaluation.section_1_intro: Prompt quality directly impacts AI output quality. Ragas provides scientific metrics to measure and improve this quality systematically.
ragas_evaluation.section_1_feature_1_desc: Measure prompt effectiveness before deploying to production
ragas_evaluation.section_1_feature_2_desc: Compare different prompt versions and identify the best performer
ragas_evaluation.section_1_feature_3_desc: Make optimization decisions based on metrics, not intuition
ragas_evaluation.section_1_feature_4_desc: Track prompt quality over time and detect regressions
ragas_evaluation.section_2_faith_desc: Measures how closely the AI response follows the prompt intent (0-1 scale)
ragas_evaluation.section_2_relevancy_desc: Evaluates how relevant the generated response is to the prompt question (0-1)
ragas_evaluation.section_2_precision_desc: Assesses quality and relevance of context used for generation (0-1)
ragas_evaluation.section_2_recall_desc: Measures completeness of context retrieval from knowledge base (0-1)
ragas_evaluation.section_2_semantic_desc: Evaluates alignment between expected and actual outputs (0-1)
ragas_evaluation.section_3_npm_desc: Add Ragas to your Node.js project
ragas_evaluation.section_3_provider_desc: Set up your preferred LLM (OpenAI, Claude, Cohere, etc.)
ragas_evaluation.section_3_dataset_desc: Create a dataset with prompts and expected responses
ragas_evaluation.section_5_example_1_desc: Check if your prompt generates accurate summaries
ragas_evaluation.section_5_example_2_desc: Measure how well your classification prompt works
ragas_evaluation.section_6_threshold_desc: Set quality thresholds for automatic approval/rejection
ragas_evaluation.section_7_practice_1: Test with diverse datasets to ensure robustness
ragas_evaluation.section_7_practice_3: Monitor all metrics, not just one
ragas_evaluation.section_7_practice_5: Integrate into CI/CD for continuous quality checks
ragas_evaluation.quiz_q1_exp: Ragas is specifically designed for evaluating AI prompt quality
ragas_evaluation.quiz_q2: What's a good Faithfulness score threshold?
ragas_evaluation.quiz_q2_exp: Generally, 0.7+ is considered good for production use
ragas_evaluation.quiz_q3_exp: Context Recall specifically measures completeness of context retrieval

spec_driven_development.page_title: Spec Driven Development | Master Structured Development
spec_driven_development.page_description: Learn Spec Driven Development methodology. Master workflow, GitHub integration, writing specs, and team adoption strategies.
spec_driven_development.title: Spec Driven Development
spec_driven_development.subtitle: Eliminate ambiguity and build better features with specification-first development
spec_driven_development.learn_1: Understand the Spec Driven Development philosophy
spec_driven_development.learn_3: Integrate specs with GitHub Issues and PRs
spec_driven_development.learn_4: Write effective specifications that guide implementation
spec_driven_development.section_1_intro: Spec Driven Development prioritizes clear specifications before implementation, ensuring alignment between requirements, design, code, and testing.
spec_driven_development.section_1_feature_1_desc: Clear specs reduce 90% of development ambiguity and rework
spec_driven_development.section_1_feature_2_desc: Teams understand requirements before coding starts
spec_driven_development.section_1_feature_3_desc: Developers know exactly what to build
spec_driven_development.section_1_feature_4_desc: Clear success criteria make testing straightforward
spec_driven_development.section_2_step_1_desc: Create detailed feature specification in GitHub issue
spec_driven_development.section_2_step_2_desc: Team reviews for clarity, feasibility, and alignment
spec_driven_development.section_2_step_5_desc: Update CLAUDE.md or docs with new patterns
spec_driven_development.section_3_issues_desc: Create GitHub issues with 'spec' label for feature specifications
spec_driven_development.section_3_discussions_desc: Use GitHub Discussions for design decisions and debates
spec_driven_development.section_3_prs_desc: Reference specification issues in PR descriptions for traceability
spec_driven_development.section_3_checklists_desc: Use issue checklists to track specification completion
spec_driven_development.section_4_structure_content:
# [Feature Name] Specification

## Description
Brief overview

## Requirements
- [ ] Requirement 1

## Architecture
How it fits

## Database Changes
Tables affected

## API Endpoints
Endpoints needed

## Success Criteria
Definition of done
spec_driven_development.section_5_auth_desc: Complete spec for implementing user authentication
spec_driven_development.section_5_notification_desc: Spec for building email and in-app notifications
spec_driven_development.section_6_training_desc: Educate team on spec writing and review process
spec_driven_development.section_6_process_desc: Make spec review a standard part of development
spec_driven_development.section_6_templates_desc: Standardize spec format across your team
spec_driven_development.section_7_federated_desc: Break large specs into smaller, manageable pieces
spec_driven_development.section_7_versioning_desc: Track how specs evolve over time
spec_driven_development.section_7_reuse_desc: Create libraries of reusable specification patterns
spec_driven_development.section_8_good_2: Use specs to guide code review
spec_driven_development.section_8_good_3: Keep specs updated as requirements change
spec_driven_development.section_8_good_4: Celebrate spec-driven wins with the team
spec_driven_development.section_8_bad_4: Not updating specs when requirements change
spec_driven_development.quiz_q1: What percentage of development ambiguity does Spec Driven reduce?
spec_driven_development.quiz_q1_exp: Well-written specs eliminate 90% of development ambiguity

tutorials.complete_quiz_tip: Complete the quiz at the end to validate this lesson
tutorials.quiz_validation_description: Answer the questions to complete this lesson
tutorials.quiz_partial_answers: You got {score} out of {totalQuestions} answers correct

wizard.additional_context_placeholder: Ex: Target audience is e-commerce entrepreneurs with limited budgets
wizard.assistant_example: Assistant: "Here's a 3-pillar strategy: 1) Visual storytelling... 2) Community engagement..."
wizard.assistant_example_hint: üí° Provide a concrete example of the desired format/style of response
wizard.assistant_example_placeholder:
Ex: Instagram Strategy for Artisan Caf√©

üéØ Pillar 1: Behind the scenes
- Show roasting process
- Producer portraits
...
wizard.assistant_when: To provide examples of the desired response format or style. Improves consistency.
wizard.best_practice_1: Use clear action verbs (Create, Analyze, List, Generate...)
wizard.best_practice_2: Specify expected length (word count, points, sections...)
wizard.best_practice_3: Provide a concrete example if the format is complex
wizard.chatgpt_desc: OpenAI's conversational AI, excellent for general tasks
wizard.chatgpt_style: Clear instructions with context. Responds well to role-play and structured formats.
wizard.claude_desc: Anthropic's helpful, harmless, and honest assistant
wizard.claude_style: Detailed explanations work best. Excels with step-by-step reasoning and nuanced tasks.
wizard.description: Create perfectly optimized prompts for ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and more. Understand the differences between system, user and assistant prompts.
wizard.gemini_style: Natural language with clear goals. Works well with contextual information.
wizard.llama_style: Direct and specific. Benefits from explicit formatting instructions.
wizard.output_format_placeholder: Ex: Bullet list, table, JSON, paragraph...
wizard.pro_tip_text: For best results, combine all 3 types: System defines the role, User asks the question, Assistant shows an example response. This approach ensures consistent and accurate responses.
wizard.step1_heading: Which AI model will you use?
wizard.step1_subtitle: Each AI has its strengths. Choose the one that matches your need.
wizard.step1_title: What do you want to create?
wizard.step2_subtitle: The 3 key elements for creating a high-performing prompt
wizard.step3_subtitle: Establish the AI's role and behavior
wizard.step4_subtitle: The specific question or task you want to accomplish
wizard.system_desc: Defines the overall behavior and role of the AI
wizard.system_example: You are a digital marketing expert with 10 years of experience. You provide practical, actionable advice.
wizard.system_prompt_hint: üí° Include: expertise, tone, response style, constraints
wizard.system_prompt_placeholder: Ex: You are a digital marketing expert with 10 years of experience. You provide practical, data-driven advice tailored to SMBs. Your tone is professional yet accessible.
wizard.system_when: To establish context, tone, constraints, and the AI's role. This is the baseline 'personality'.
wizard.title: Optimized Prompt Creator
wizard.user_example: Create an Instagram content strategy for an artisan coffee brand
wizard.user_prompt_hint: üí° Be specific: what, why, expected format
wizard.user_prompt_placeholder: Ex: Create an Instagram content strategy for an artisan coffee brand. Include 3 content pillars and 10 post ideas.
wizard.user_when: To ask your specific question or request a precise task. This is your input.

techStack.hero_subtitle: Built on cutting-edge tools and methodologies to ensure prompt quality, code excellence, and systematic development
techStack.claude_code_intro: Seamlessly integrated AI coding assistant that understands your project context and generates code following established patterns.
techStack.claude_code_point_1: Generates features following Next.js 15 + Supabase patterns
techStack.claude_code_point_2: Refactors code while maintaining TypeScript safety and consistency
techStack.claude_code_point_3: Debugs issues with full project context understanding
techStack.claude_code_point_4: Creates documentation aligned with project standards
techStack.claude_code_tab_overview_content: Claude Code is an AI-powered development assistant seamlessly integrated with your project. It reads your CLAUDE.md guidelines and generates code that follows your established patterns and conventions. Access it at claude.ai/code or via the CLI.
techStack.claude_code_tab_setup_content: Access Claude Code at https://claude.ai/code or install the Claude Code CLI. Link your repository to enable context-aware assistance. The assistant will automatically reference your CLAUDE.md file for project guidelines and conventions.
techStack.claude_code_tab_usage_content: Describe your requirements in natural language. Claude Code understands your project architecture and generates implementation following your patterns. Ask for code review, refactoring, debugging, or documentation. The assistant maintains TypeScript safety and design consistency throughout.
techStack.claude_code_tab_examples_content: Feature generation: 'Create a new dashboard component with Next.js 15 App Router' ‚Üí Generates component following project patterns. Refactoring: 'Improve error handling in the auth module' ‚Üí Updates code with proper error management. Documentation: 'Generate API docs for the webhook handler' ‚Üí Creates comprehensive documentation.
techStack.claude_code_tab_best_practices_content: Provide clear requirements with examples. Ask for code review to validate implementations. Use for feature development, refactoring, debugging, and documentation. Always review generated code before merging. Reference CLAUDE.md patterns for consistency.
techStack.ragas_intro: Industry-standard framework for evaluating and measuring the quality, effectiveness, and relevance of AI prompts.
techStack.ragas_point_3: Provides quality metrics and detailed reports
techStack.ragas_tab_overview_content: Ragas is an open-source framework for evaluating LLM outputs using industry-standard metrics. It helps measure prompt quality across multiple dimensions including faithfulness, relevance, and contextual accuracy. Install with: pnpm add ragas
techStack.ragas_tab_setup_content: Install Ragas: pnpm add ragas or npm install ragas. Configure with your preferred LLM provider (OpenAI, Claude, etc.). Set up evaluation datasets. Initialize metrics for your use case. Integrate into your CI/CD pipeline for continuous quality monitoring.
techStack.ragas_tab_usage_content: Evaluate single prompts: ragas evaluate --prompt "your-prompt" --responses "response-data". Batch evaluate: ragas evaluate-batch --input prompts.json --output metrics.json. Generate reports: ragas report --metrics faithfulness,relevancy,context-precision. Use in code: const metrics = await evaluatePrompt({prompt, responses, model})
techStack.ragas_tab_examples_content: Evaluate before publishing: Check faithfulness > 0.8 and relevancy > 0.85 before adding to featured collection. Benchmark improvements: Compare metrics before/after prompt optimization. Monitor quality: Track trending metrics across all prompts. Identify issues: Find prompts with low precision or recall.
techStack.ragas_tab_metrics_content: Faithfulness: How closely responses follow prompt intent (0-1). Answer Relevancy: Relevance of generated responses to prompt (0-1). Context Precision: Quality and relevance of retrieved context (0-1). Context Recall: Completeness of context retrieval (0-1). Semantic Similarity: Alignment between expectations and responses (0-1).
techStack.spec_driven_intro: Clear specifications before implementation ensuring alignment between requirements, design, code, and validation.
techStack.spec_driven_point_4: Ensures quality assurance at every step
techStack.spec_driven_tab_overview_content: Spec Driven Development prioritizes clear specifications before implementation. This methodology ensures alignment between requirements, design, code, and testing. Everyone understands feature intent before coding starts, reducing ambiguity and rework significantly.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_workflow_content: 1. Write Spec: Create detailed feature specification in GitHub issue with requirements, architecture, and success criteria. 2. Review: Team reviews for clarity and feasibility. 3. Implement: Developers code following approved specification. 4. Validate: Testing ensures requirements are met. 5. Document: Update CLAUDE.md with new patterns.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_github_content: Use Issues with 'spec' label for feature specifications. Create Discussions for design decisions. Link PRs to specification issues for traceability. Use checklists in issues to track spec completion. Include spec templates for consistency. Tag stakeholders for review.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_template_content:
# [Feature Name] Specification

## Description
Brief overview

## Requirements
- [ ] Requirement 1
- [ ] Requirement 2

## Architecture
How it fits existing system

## Database Changes
Tables/columns affected

## API Endpoints
Endpoints to create/modify

## Testing Strategy
Validation approach

## Success Criteria
Definition of done
techStack.spec_driven_tab_best_practices_content: Write specs in clear, accessible language avoiding jargon. Include examples and use cases. Define scope boundaries clearly. Get spec approval before implementing. Update spec if requirements change. Use checklists to track progress. Review completed work against spec.

techStack.faq_subtitle: Everything you need to know about our tech stack
techStack.faq_integration_q: How does Claude Code integrate with our codebase?
techStack.faq_integration_a: Claude Code reads your CLAUDE.md file and understands your project structure, conventions, and patterns. It generates code that follows your established guidelines. Link your GitHub repository during setup for seamless integration.
techStack.faq_cost_q: What is the cost of implementing Ragas?
techStack.faq_cost_a: Ragas is open-source and free. You only pay for LLM API calls used for evaluation. Implementation is straightforward with a few lines of code or CLI commands.
techStack.faq_onboarding_q: How long does it take to onboard with Spec Driven Development?
techStack.faq_onboarding_a: Teams can start writing specs immediately. Most teams see productivity improvements within the first sprint. Full organizational adoption typically takes 1-2 months with training.
techStack.faq_scalability_q: Is this tech stack scalable for high growth?
techStack.faq_scalability_a: Yes. Vercel's edge network scales globally. Supabase handles millions of concurrent users. Our Next.js + TypeScript architecture supports growth without major rewrites.
techStack.faq_security_a: Supabase offers row-level security (RLS) for data protection. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest. GDPR, SOC 2, and other compliance standards are supported.
techStack.faq_customization_q: Can we customize these tools for our specific needs?
techStack.faq_customization_a: Claude Code adapts to your patterns in CLAUDE.md. Ragas metrics are configurable. All other tools are open-source and fully customizable.
techStack.faq_migration_q: What's the migration path from other tools?
techStack.faq_migration_a: We provide migration guides for each tool. Claude Code can help automate code refactoring. Ragas integrates with existing pipelines. Contact support for detailed planning.
techStack.faq_support_a: Community support via Discord and GitHub. Enterprise support with SLA available. Documentation covers all tools. Regular training sessions and workshops.
